name: Rustem Pasha Mosque
description: A tiny, hidden gem covered in blue Iznik tiles. Much quieter than the Blue Mosque.

name: Pierre Loti Hill
description: A hilltop cafe with the best views of the Golden Horn. Great for tea.

name: Balat District
description: Colorful houses and hipster cafes. Very instagrammable and less touristy.

name: Ulucanlar Prison Museum
description: A former state prison turned museum, offering a deep dive into Turkey's political history.

name: Hamamönü
description: A restored Ottoman-era district with traditional houses, handicrafts, and cafes.

name: Kuğulu Park
description: A peaceful park in the city center famous for its swans and relaxing atmosphere.

name: Vazelon Monastery
description: An ancient cliffside monastery, older and less crowded than Sumela, offering solitude and views.

name: Çal Cave
description: One of the world's longest caves with a stream running through it and impressive formations.

name: Sera Lake
description: A tranquil landslide-formed lake with emerald waters, perfect for boating and picnics.

name: Kaymakli Underground City
description: A vast underground city with eight floors, offering a glimpse into ancient subterranean life.

name: Soğanlı Valley
description: A serene valley with rock-cut churches and pigeon houses, away from the main tourist crowds.

name: Selime Monastery
description: The largest rock-cut monastery in Cappadocia, featuring a cathedral and panoramic views.
